chapter.title: Module
chapter.para: The module constitutes the client side of the Customer Relationship Management (CRM) features available in . It gives you an electronic channel of communication with the Trade Services team of all the banks your company is entitled to liaise with through the portal.

This module is primarily for non-transactional requests (for transactions, the appropriate Product module and function should rather be used), and typically provides a way for you to submit your questions such as requests for quotes on specific services to a bank's trade team.

The organisation of this simple knowledge base is similar to a database of Frequently Asked Questions. You have access to domains representing each relationship your company has with banks within . These contain folders, which in turn contain topics with sets of questions and answers.

informalexample.para: For example, imagine that your company (whose abbreviated name is Company1) has signed up with two banks ( Bank1 and Bank2 ) of one banking group (BankGroup) for access to . You therefore have access to three domains - for communicating with these two branches and the higher entity represented by the bank group itself.

chapter.para: Therefore, when you access the initial Business Requests screen, you are presented with a list of all the domains your company has accessed to. In the situation described here, three domains appear: Bank1 - Company1, Bank2 - Company1 and BankGroup - Company1.

Within each domain, folders set up by the branch are available to you to organise your questions and answers. A typical folder could for instance be called Importer Area, to address concerns specific to importers. One level deeper, the topics organise the information within one folder, and each of them contains a set of questions and answers.

It is up to the bank to create and organise the folders and topics. As a user at a client company, you can browse or search through the existing folders and topics, and submit new questions which will immediately become visible to the users at the appropriate bank.

section.title: Using CRM
section.para: When you click Business Requests, you are presented with a list of domains available to your company. Click the one for the bank you want to send a question to.

Alternatively you can click Search to search for questions containing a given text, or List Unanswered for a list of all questions that users at your company have submitted but that have not yet been answered. These two functions are available on every page in .
No function in enables you to see questions submitted from other client companies.

Having selected a domain, you then get a list of folders in that domain. If you get Sorry, there are currently no available folders for this domain, it means the bank has not yet created any. It is up to the bank to create folders and topics.

Click a folder in the list to get a tree view showing the topics in that folder, and the questions within the topics. Each question is followed by a number showing how many answers the bank has posted for it. Click a question in the tree view to see the full question and its answers.

Alternatively, click a topic in the tree view to get a tree view showing just that topic and the questions within it. From this single-topic view (and from no other) you get an additional function Add New Question. To submit a question to the bank, click this link, type your question, and click Save.

Your question is immediately added to the database and so is accessible to users both at the bank and at your company. It is also brought to the attention of the users at the bank by appearing in the list of Trade Recent Requests on their home pages
At the top of each page in your tree view is a toolbar (sometimes called a breadcrumb trail) showing where in the tree you currently are. You can move back up the tree by clicking in this toolbar.
